input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Immunodeficiency due to defects of the thymus

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
You are a patient: You are a 7-year-old boy.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Pale skin, noticeable and persistent
- General malaise and feeling unusually tired
- A distended abdomen that has become more noticeable over the past few weeks
- Skin manifestations such as rashes and some vesicles appearing on your arms and face
- Some areas showing telangiectasia (small visible blood vessels)
These symptoms came into fruition gradually over the past month, starting with occasional rashes and fatigue that seemed to worsen over time. You’ve also noticed your abdomen looks more swollen than usual, and you often feel weak and malaise even after resting. Your parents are concerned because your skin looks unusually pale and blotchy, and you seem to catch every cold easily. Your family has a history of immunodeficiency, which worries your parents even more.
output:
THINKING: The patient is a young boy with a complex range of symptoms that have developed gradually. He's likely confused about the timeline, so I need to gather more details without overwhelming him. I should 
ANSWER: I guess I just feel really tired all the time, and my skin looks funny—kind of pale and blotchy, and I get rashes and tiny blisters on my arms and face. My tummy feels bigger than before, and I get more tired even when I rest. My parents are worried because I get sick a lot, and they say my skin is weird.
thinking: The patient is a young boy with a complex range of symptoms that have developed gradually. He's likely confused about the timeline, so I need to gather more details without overwhelming him. I should
answer: I guess I just feel really tired all the time, and my skin looks funny—kind of pale and blotchy, and I get rashes and tiny blisters on my arms and face. My tummy feels bigger than before, and I get more tired even when I rest. My parents are worried because I get sick a lot, and they say my skin is weird.
